reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were booked here for our first nite in Nova Scotia but unfortunately with airline delays we did not arrive until the next day. When I called to cancel, the owners were very understanding. I was prepared to pay a penalty for the late cancelation but they were kind enough to waive the fees. We were able to drive by on our way to Lunenburg the next day. The Clifty Cove is in a great location & is definitely on our to stay our next visit to Nova Scotia.
reviews.title: Almost made it.

reviews.text: Motel is basic,no phone or coffee in the room,but the people were really friendly.They offered us kettle if we neded for tea,there was laundry room available and also barbeque.the beds were comfortable and the room was clean.We were told not to drink the water,but the management provided bottled water.Sound of the ocean waves as you go to sleep is awesome.Motel is very close to Peggy's Cove and the owners(or managers) were great in giving directions and telling us about the area.My daughter played with their dog and really liked the place(and she is hard to please!).I think it was a good price(95 $CAN) for summer.Would recommend it for short stay.
reviews.title: Good for a short stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.title: Clifty Cove Motel, read this!

reviews.text: We stopped on July 6th, 2009. By A Yahoo! Contributor, 07/26/09We had been driving the costal highway all day from the east, stopped here to check the room rates, 96.05 Canadian dollars per night. Desk clerk, her home is attached to the office, not friendly at all. About 830pm, she tells us everything, including the restaurant closes at 9pm in Peggy's Cove. We rushed back to it and got in just before closing. Showed back up at Clifty Cove at 10:20pm. Lady who runs the motel was hateful, she said she stated earlier that check in time is 10pm, and didn't want to let us look at the room first, the outside does look rather aged. So, we sign up, go to our room, outta there. The outside makes the drab, ancient furniture, and the warped old brown paneling on the wall downright depressing. We went back in under six minutes according to reciepts and asked for a refund. Motel lady was nasty hateful telling us we were quiet the nuisance. We had been polite with her at all times. She snatches a booklet out of her drawer telling me she couldn't give a refund then late admitted she didn't know how. Read her instruction book for the card machine for at least 10 minutes, keys everything in, and tells us a refund is complete. I told her the reciept was another charge, not a refund, she basically told us it was a refund, and she was locking the door. We left, GPS'ed back 15 minutes to Big Lake Lodge @ 5849 Hwy 333 in West Dover Nova Scotia. Clean, overlooks a big beautiful lake, man who owns the place lives there is very pleasant, happy to get up past 11pm and rent us a room for 98.31 in Canadian dollars. Got home, two charges for Clifty Cove on the credit card. So because the lady? at Clifty Cove lies now and said one charge is valid we have to send all the reciepts, Visa finds it interesting as well that we have a reciept the same night for another hotel. Moral of this story, unless you like drab run down hotels, with a hateful desk clerk to match, don't bother stopping at Clifty Cove on your otherwise beautiful drive through Peggy's Cove in Nova Scotia. It was the one and only bad experience we had on the whole two week trip in Nova Scotia, honestly. [--]
reviews.title: Symly beautifull

reviews.text: I'v been there for 6 nights. The rooms are basic but the location and the view is excelent. Also ther sevice was very good. When we came with our fresh hot lobsters from ryers (just 200 m away and best prices 9,24 per lb and you also can eat them there), jana (the owner) provided us with a candle stove to melt our butter and a opener for our wine.
reviews.title: Great location but bothersome smell

likes.disliked: — Owner not able to confirm reservation by email, no internet booking available, room odor, filfy bed sheets

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Clifty Cove is a very, very basic motel experience. Besides having an ok view of the ocean, the beds are nice, and the water is hot, and the tv is good. I was disappointed to see that most dreaded of bug, the 'water bug', aka roach, in the small bathroom (with a leaky water faucet - probably why he was hanging around) :p Just a wee little guy, but still...
reviews.title: Not bad.

reviews.text: However, overall it wasn't bad, and was easy to find and convenient to Peggy's Cove and other cute beachy areas around Halifax. Set your expectations realistically.
reviews.title: Basic But Great

reviews.text: Great family owned motel. Basic but clean with wonderful ocean cove view from the room. Very accommodating owners, even let me use their phone and came to get me when I received a return call. We ended up buying the property that was for sale next door. Beautiful part of Nova Scotia.
reviews.title: Absolute Paradise

reviews.text: We stayed for 3 nights and wish we could've stayed forever. Very basic but exceptionally clean. Great rates and friendly proprietors made for a pleasant stay. Very close to Peggy's Cove. If you'd just like to relax, you can take a beer with you and sit behind the motel in their Muskoka chairs and just watch the ocean. Amazing. A few nice restaurants close by all with the typical down east laid back feel. Thinking about going back this summer for a week or 2.
reviews.title: Awesome Motel - Stay Here!!
Good basic motel room, low rates, million-dollar view!
reviews.text: This was a wonderful motel with an awesome view of the bay. We were totally pleased with our stay. Prices were reasonable.
